message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR

This paper presents a method for estimating the pose of a camera with respect to a robot, which is a common problem in robotics (cs.RO). The method uses a deep neural network to process an RGB image, which involves computer vision techniques (cs.CV). The network is trained using domain randomization, which is a machine learning technique (cs.LG). The paper also mentions the use of perspective-$n$-point (P$n$P), which is a classic algorithm in computer vision and robotics (cs.AI). Finally, the paper presents experimental results for different camera sensors, which involves graphics and visualization techniques (cs.GR).
